lines.text: Look at the Goddamn moon! It's glorious!
Are you out of your mind? What the hell were you thinking about?
You're yelling.
Of course I'm yelling! My daughter tells some stranger that her father is her, her...
*Lover*!
Oh, God! I hate that word. It's so... so graphic. Who else thinks this?
A few of the other people.
How many of them?
All of them.
All of them! Incroyable! I've been walking around here with you the past few days. They think I'm child molester!

[she starts to cry]
You're yelling again.
Why... why do you make up such stories?
I don't know. It just comes naturally to me.
So it's genetic. Is that it?
Yes. No! I don't know.
You have to tell him the truth.
I tried to. Believe me, it's not that easy. I care about him.

[he smiles at her]
Do you love him?
Yes, I think so. I mean, yes, I do.
Has he done anything to you?
No, he hasn't done anything to me. Besides, if I tell him I made all this up, he'll hate me. He'll think I'm some kind of liar.
You are.
How did it go?
He's very impressed by you. He thinks you're a great guy.

[sarcastically]
What a relief.
And I told him I'm staying with you.
Isn't he jealous?
I told him there's nothing to be jealous of. That there's nothing between us anymore because of... Promise you won't get mad?
Why do I get so frightened every time you ask me that?
Because of your heart.
My heart? What about my heart?
I told him you were dying.
I'm dying now.
[everyone in the balcony looks at him]
Daddy. I told him I had to stay with you for your final days.
*My final days*? What's the matter with you?
I don't know once I start lying, I can't stop. It's kind of addictive.
What I'm dying of?
A rare disease you caught in Africa.
When was I in Africa?
During the Hundred Years War.
The Hundred Years War was in the Middle Ages, in Europe!
He didn't seem to notice.
Why not the Crusades?
[Nicole rolls her eyes at him]
I'm having an affair with my phone machine.
[Nicole stands up, wearing a thong bathing suit]
What - what's that?
What's the matter?
What are you wearing?
My bathing suit!
The whole thing?
What, you don't like it?
Are you sure you didn't leave part of it in the box?
Get real, Andre. Everybody's wearing them.
Everyone's staring at you!
No, everyone's staring at you.
I insist you change!
And I insist you loosen up, Andre, dear.
[Kisses him on the cheek]
Now she's French.
You know, one these days I'm leaving and I'm never coming back.
Fine. Go live with you father.
Oh, you're such a bitch.
To you I probably seem old.
You are old.
Daddy, can I talk to you about something?
Of course. You can talk to me about anything.
Anything?
Anything at all. What is it? Tell me.
Promise not to yell.
I promise. Now tell me.
It's really not that bad.
Tell me.
You said you wouldn't yell.
That was not yelling, trust me.
I told Ben you weren't my father.
Why?
Because I wanted to impress him.
What did you tell him I was? A famous pianist? A wirter? What?

[she takes a deep breath]
I told him you were my lover.
Are you serious?
Yes.
My whole life will be ruined.
No. No, no. Your life will not be ruined. Mine maybe, but yours won't.
He'll hate me!
No, no, he won't hate you.
Yes, he will! I'm going to die!
